title: I disliked not having my children…
text: I disliked not having my children covered for 2 years after spending almost two hours on the phone w/rep walking me through it. So for two years my children weren't covered.I don't like the fact that the accidental doesn't hold cash value. I also don't like the fact that I can not add my children (especially my minor son) to my whole life policy. Leaving me to have to find another life insurance company to get my minor child insured which is an inconvenience to have to pay two carriers.

title: Waiting on paperwork

title: Lower the price from the age of 60
text: Lower the price from age 60 to 80. It unrealistic to expect after the age of 60 that those high payments will be easily made. It's very unfair after paying 10 years that the risk of not being able to pay the premium is a realistic fact.

title: Not a big fan of insurance companies
text: Not a big fan of insurance companies. I think the market is always in there favor and hardly ever the favor of the insured. I’m not really even sure if the policy that I have will even benefit me or is even right for me. Because I did not have any life insurance, other than through my work, I thought it would be better to have something over nothing and it was the most reasonable so far that I have found for my age.

title: I just wish the Representatives would…understand that as a customer you know close to nothing about purchasing Life Insurance and I wish they would guide you step by step so when you're done you know

title: I have seen other offers of term life…

title: As stated earlier

title: I am very happy with policy number one
text: I am very happy with policy number one. Since I was offered an upgrade, so to speak or to add additional coverage, that has not been as pleasant as my first experience. Before I went on vacation I called to voice my concern about the verbage and policy number two and the fact that the second policy was not at the same rate as the first as was indicated in the advertisement I was sent. I spoke to a manager/supervisor who was supposed to look at the information and give me a call back that was around June 3rd. To date I have not received a call back. I am very unhappy with how my second policy is being handled. I will address this again with a call to the company and will determine if I keep policy number one and policy number two.
